New Records: Emilio Nsue scored the first hat-trick at the Africa Cup of Nations since 2008 for Equatorial Guinea against Guinea-Bissau
Key Match Events: Mohamed Salah suffered a hamstring injury and was forced off the field in the last minute of the first half
Mohammed Kudus broke the deadlock with a brilliant left-footed shot into the bottom corner
Mostafa Marmoush equalised for Egypt with a calm finish from a narrow angle
Osman Bukari was dispossessed by Trézéguet on the right-hand side of his own area and Mostafa Mohamed stabbed home the equaliser
Miscellaneous Highlights: The breathless action showed no signs of slowing
The result meant Nigeria drew level with Equatorial Guinea on four points in the group
Others: The opening goal arrived in the 21st minute following a poor clearance by Guinea-Bissau’s goalkeeper Ouparine Djoco
Guinea-Bissau, beaten by hosts Ivory Coast in their opening match, equalised after 37 minutes when Mauro Rodrigues sent a low cross into the box and defender Esteban turned the ball into his own net
